Posts.Content: Aug 4, 2011 12:18PM mrfiedler wrote: I have to say... I am on Day 3 of my first treatment and I feel pretty good. I'm surprised that this has been better than I expected while, at the same time, fearful that there is some terrible side effect looming! Yesterday I felt great (maybe the lingering effect of the steriod). Today I have some muscle aches, sore throat, slight tingling of the fingertips and my scalp is a bit tender.  The only kink on the day of my treatment was my low white blood cell count; no idea why it would be low. Yesterday I had to go back for a Neulasta injection. No real bone pain today. Was surprised by the recommendation to take Claritin before and after the shot.    All of that said, I really can't complain. Is there something waiting to sneak up on my and kick my butt? Do the SEs build with each treatment? vtEllen: I've not had any trouble with nausea. Had Aloxi (sp?) in my pre-med drip and was sent home with scripts for Compasine and Zofran. As a precaution, I've taken the Compasine the past 3 days but have had no nausea at all! I hope the same is true for you!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 01:44PM mrfiedler wrote: Today I picked up a bottle of BioSil to help strengthen my nails as I understand that Taxotere can cause ridges, brittleness and color changes to the nail bed. (It doesn't hurt that BioSil has hair and skin benefits, too.) Oh... the wig is purchased and my head is scheduled to be shaved on Day 15 after #1. <taking a deep breath> Trying hard to stay positive and I keep reminding myself that it could be much worse, right? Thank you all very much for the kind words and positive advice.  Tomorrow's the day... fingers crossed!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 03:06PM mrfiedler wrote: Hi gals... I spoke with a friend of mine who is a clinical pharmacist and has spend his entire career (20+ years) working with oncology/chemo meds and regimens. While he did say that everyone's experience is unique, he suggested that SEs from a 4x TC regimen are very tolerable, that issues with nausea are slim with this protocol, and the biggest challenges are with fatigue and blood count. When I read through some of the posts here, it seems that many are having far greater challenges. My first treatment is Tuesday. The fear of the unknown - how the SEs will effect me - is weighing heavy on my mind. I'm not sleeping well, have a lot of anxiety. How were you up to and after your first treatment. Does getting through the first experience make it easier to go forward? Thanks for your help! -Maryanne
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 27, 2011 03:13PM mrfiedler wrote: Hi everyone. I'm new here; this is my first post. Starting Cytoxan/Taxotere on 8/2, 4 treatments once every 3 weeks. Terrified! Worried about hair loss (of course), side effects, being sick. Thought that knowledge would be power as I prepare for treatment but am now thinking that perhaps ignorance is bliss. :) Has anyone here tried any of the gels and remedies for keeping eyebrows and eyelashes? I was reading about a product from Brian Joseph. Any experience? There is strength in numbers... so much support here! Thanks. -Maryanne
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Jul 31, 2011 04:34PM mrfiedler wrote: chickadee521 / vlnrph - thanks for the suggestion. My MO did indicate that Ativan would be included in my post-meds. Apparently, reducing the risk of anxiety also staves off nausea. I am planning to work and am fortunate enough to have the flexibility to work from home on days when I'm too tired to go into the office.  Regarding blood count, my friend the pharmacist mentioned Neulasta on Day 2 but I don't remember my MO specifically mentioning is as part of the meds.   What about aches, pains, flu-like symptons? Any experience with these side effects?   I'm glad to hear good stories about the SEs and am so glad to hear that so many dealing with this disease are doing well. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 8, 2011 01:37PM mrfiedler wrote: I have a question about mouth issues. I have a terrible sore throat that has been buidling each day; started on Day 2... terrible today (Day 7). There seems to be a sore on the inside of my right cheek, the underside of my tongue is painful (you know that tendon that seems to hold your tongue to the bottom of your mouth?) and the top and sides of my mouth feel gritty. My oncologist gave me a half-gallon of sterile water that I added salt and baking soda to for daily mouthwash and gargle 4x/day. Any great tips or remedies that might make my mouth a bit more comfortable? kll22 - congratulations on getting to the end of your treatments!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 11, 2011 04:43PM mrfiedler wrote: I did call my MO about the issues with my throat and mouth. Thankfully she called in a prescription for something she called Magic Mouthwash; a solution of lydocaine (sp?), benadryl and maalox. Tastes terrible, completely numbs the mouth and throat, but I am feeling so much better. It is truly Magic! Skin rash continues to be a problem. Now on my arms, legs, and backs of my palms and fingers. MO says it is from the Taxotere.  Congratulations vlnrph!
Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxan starting June 2011 vlnrph chickadee521

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2011 04:50PM mrfiedler wrote: Hi vtEllen. I will check out the other group, thank you. I've also been getting some great feedback from "Taxotere/Cytoxan starting July 2011" group. I had stayed away from the message boards for fear that reading others' experienes would make me more anxious. It wasn't until I got my Oncotype DX score and knew that chemo was a definite that I really got engaged here.  I"m glad I did! Good luck this week! My fingers are crossed for you!

Posts.Title: Taxotere/Cytoxin starting August 2011 vtellen vlnrph

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2011 04:11PM mrfiedler wrote: Hi Eileen - it really is something new every day, isn't it? A girlfriend of mine who has been through this (unfortunately) suggested that I sleep in a hairnet to minimize hair loss overnight, use a wide-toothed comb and skip my daily washings. Whether or not it helps me hold on until Wednesday remains to be seen, but I'll try anything! I thought hard about just letting it fall out on it's own versus the pre-emptive head shave - I decided that I'm probably not strong enough to see it fall out. Either way it's not easy! I think tomorrow I'm wearing a baseball cap to work - OY! Madismommy79 - me, too! And I hope you get there as well.  Thanks. lstreett - Be sure to have something to eat before your treatment. You'll want to keep your blood sugar normal.  I had breakfast before heading to the hospital for my 1st treatment. In spite of that, my CBC showed low blood sugar and my MO sent me to the hospital snack bar for orange juice and a snack before my infusion.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2011 07:50AM mrfiedler wrote: Hi Girls, It's is only Day 2 from 2nd TC treatment but I've feeling good this morning.  Since I had a problem with skin rashes from the Taxotere first time around, my MO added Zantac and Benadryl to my pre-meds. She also gave me a prescription for a steriod to take the day after this treatment / day before and day after #3. No nausea. Fingers crossed that it keeps up! Back this afternoon for Neulasta shot... UGH!
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2011 03:40PM mrfiedler wrote: Hi ladies, Having my 2nd TC treatment tomorrow. Hoping that I do well; no nausea the first time around. Fingers crossed that I get by as easily with #2. Are there others here with experience on TC? I'm curious about cumulating side effects with the 2nd treatment. Hair is gone - had it shaved off last week. Have decided to embrace hats and scarves instead of wearing a wig everyday. The wig(s) will be saved for "special occasions." Grimbol: I had a Neulasta shot after my first treatment and had some of the bone pain for about 3 days. My oncologist recommended Claritin; take one the morning of the shot, then each morning for a couple days after. Has anyojne gone to the ACS program, "feel good, look better?"
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie

Posts.Content: Aug 14, 2011 09:09AM mrfiedler wrote: Hi ladies,  I started TC x4 on August 2; next treatment is on the 23rd. So far the SEs haven't been too terrible. No nausea or fatigue to speak of, however, every day seems to bring about something new. I'm mostly dealing with skin rashes on legs, backs of my hands and fingers, arms, shoulders and I had terrible throat and mouth issues. Mouth sores and raw throat were painful - thankfully a call to my MO resulted in a prescription for "Magic Mouthwash." It's terrible going down, but provided overnight relief! Yesterday (Day 12), my hair officially started falling out. I have 2 wigs ready and an appointment on Wednesday this week to have it all shaved off. I'm hoping I can hold on to most of it enough to make it through the next 4 days. Terrified of this part, of course.   My golden retriever provided some comic relief the other day though.  She saw the wigs on their stands on the dresser and immediately went in to guard dog mode with growling and barking. Poor thing probably thought there were 2 strangers in the room! Thankfully a supervised sniff of both wigs settled her down. I don't have any children and can only imagine how difficult it is to take your children on this journey with you and want to keep them safe and protected. I am an ony child - telling my mother was the hardest part for me and I struggled over it for days before finally talking to her. While I understand that it is different with kids based on their ages, sometimes we take for granted how strong those who love us really are.  I have read posts here from so many brave women and find so much of what is shared to be encouraging. Thanks to all.
Posts.Title: August 2011 chemo, anyone w/ me?! vtellen MizMarie
